column4: SPECIAL REPORT-Economy-class activist investor crashes the corporate party
column5: LOS ANGELES  Oct 23 Shareholder activists come in different flavors. One is the deep-pocketed investor  such as Carl Icahn or Dan Loeb  who takes big stakes in companies and forces management to change strategy. Another type is the persistent provocateur who buys a handful of shares and agitates on a shoestring. That's John Chevedden.

column5: OTTAWA  Oct 23 Canada will allow small telecommunications firm Public Mobile to transfer the license for a block of spectrum to Telus Corp  Industry Minister James Moore said on Wednesday.

column4: Thermo Fisher's profit rises nine percent as diagnostic devices sales jump
column5: Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc   the world's largest maker of laboratory equipment  reported a 9 percent rise in quarterly profit due to strong sales of its diagnostic devices  and the company raised the low end of its full-year results forecast.

column4: Thermo Fisher's profit rises 9 pct as diagnostic devices sales jump
column5: Oct 23 Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc  the world's largest maker of laboratory equipment  reported a 9 percent rise in quarterly profit due to strong sales of its diagnostic devices  and the company raised the low end of its full-year results forecast.

column4: Telefonica may stay out of Telecom Italia's Brazil votes -TIM CEO
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Oct 23 Telecom Italia SpA  may suggest to Brazilian regulators that key shareholder Telefonica SA continue to refrain from decisions involving its Brazilian unit  TIM Participaçoes SA   TIM's CEO said on Wednesday.

column4: Output at Czech Toyota/Peugeot car plant set to fall again
column5: PRAGUE  Oct 23 Production at TPCA  the Czech car assembly plant jointly owned by Toyota Motor Corp and PSA Peugeot Citroen  is likely to drop to around 200 000 vehicles this year from 215 000 in 2012  a company spokesman said on Wednesday.

column4: Varian slashes forecast amid uncertainties in healthcare reforms
column5: Oct 23 Medical device maker Varian Medical Systems Inc reported lower-than-expected fourth-quarter results as demand for its products fell due to uncertainties related to U.S. healthcare reforms and reimbursement cuts.

column4: Whiting third-quarter profit more than doubles on surge in production
column5: Whiting Petroleum Corp   which drills for oil and natural gas in North Dakota  Texas and other shale-rich states  said its quarterly profit more than doubled as production jumped 12 percent.

column4: India's Wipro profit beats forecast  but not enough for investors
column5: BANGALORE Indian IT services exporter Wipro Ltd  posted quarterly profit which beat analyst estimates  but that was not enough for investors who sold off its stock on stronger earnings reports from rivals.
